greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n^2 mod 6.
comment: a(m*n) = a(m)*a(n) mod 6; a(3*n+k) = a(3*n-k) for k <= 3*n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 24 2009
Equivalently: n^(2*m + 2) mod 6; n^4 mod 6 is A070511; See formulas in A070511. - _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 01 2016
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1).
maple: A070431:=n->n^2 mod 6: seq(A070431(n), n=0..100); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Apr 01 2016
mathematica: PowerMod[Range[0,120],2,6] (* or *) PadRight[{},120,{0,1,4,3,4,1}] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Aug 11 2019 *)
program: (Sage) [power_mod(n,2,6) for n in range(0, 101)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Oct 30 2009
(Sage) [power_mod(n,6,6) for n in range(0, 101)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Nov 06 2009
(MAGMA) [n^2 mod 6 : n in [0..100]]; // _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Apr 01 2016
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 12 2002
